column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Queen Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
- only 2 toilets for all the rooms, very small and not clean
- very basic and small spaces, no real lounge where to way or hang out
column9:
- good location, 2 min from MRT Little India, which is a very interesting area of Singapore
- comfortable beds, with lamp, charging dock and towel provided
- very good breakfast for a hostel! Toasted bread with nutella, peanut butter and jam; corn flakes and milk

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• People with friends', '• Family Room of 4', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: the lights are automatically off at 11 pm and some guests arrive from touring later than 11 pm and it is so dark inside the room and we cannot hardly see a thing. The bed sheet seems like its not been replaced.
column9: Front desk is accomodating

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Breakfast is humble but ok. No common spaces available.
column9: Female dorm very clean and quiet. Confortable bed and pillow. Very easy to get MRT to anywhere. Could leave luggage after checkout. Wifi is good.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
Nothing really springs to mind, although some lights are automatic in the dorm and come on at 7am if not switched off at the wall.
Beds could do with a shelf, esp top bunks for glasses wearers like me!
column9:
The lights in the dorm automatically turn off at 11pm which I think is genius! The counter to this is that they also turn on in the morning - I wear an eye mask so not a real issue.
Reading lights, privacy curtains, keypad entry to dorms and main entrance - no key! Although there is a locker key.
Breakfast area is small, but perfectly usable and additional seats in the hallway. 
Have an iron and ironing board, and also a hairdryer.
Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if in SG.

column6: “Don't put this place in  your option. ”
column7: ['• Business trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Roommate was very bad, I was staying with 3 Indians in the same room talking so loud all the time, using their phone like no one else in the room even it was 3 am they still talking on the phone, locker was broken and especially toilets suck dirty. There is no way I will go back there
column9: Staffs are nice

column6: “Lovely hostel with clean facilities, kind staff, and great restaurants and a train station nearby ”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The toilet was dirty and had the previous tenant's tissue stuck in the drain.
column9: The bed was cozy, lockers were safe and near the bed, staff was hospitable, and breakfast was good. The hostel is also near a bunch of Indian and vegetarian restaurants that offered meals at affordable prices. It's also a 5-8 minute walk to Little India station.

column6: “5 minute distance to MRT station, a lot of nearby...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column9:
5 minute distance to MRT station, a lot of nearby restaurants, staff is helpful and even helped to print my tickets. 
Breakfast was very good even though it was just tea/coffee, orange slices, bread and cereals. Nevertheless, felt very good in the morning.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 5 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: nothing unsatisfied.
column9:
The location is very good. It's closer from MRT Little India exit E than MRT Rocher. All my roommate in the passed 5 nights are very nice. The staff in reception are good, they are willing to help everyone. The room for girls has window and separate bathroom inside.
it's worth for the price.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• People with friends', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
-Toilette was flooded 
-Bath was in the outside and really Spartan
-The room had six beds and there was around 20cm space for the body and luggage between the bed and the wall
-Breakfast room was always crowded and there was not enough space
-The lighting always went on at 7 am in the morning and made it hard to sleep on
-the upper bunk beds were blown on by fans and AC, giving us a cold
-The floor, especially below the bunk beds, were very dirty and when getting from the flooded shower back to your bed, the foot was dirty 
-Hostel was not Worth the Price Tag
Think twice before booking, if you don’t care about the above stated - go for it. However, the experience was more of a light prison than a hostel. We were really happy when we could leave this place!
column9:
-Great Wifi
-Great AC
-Location was nothing special but okay
-Breakfast was good, there were cereals and toast
-Staff did a good job and the bed covers and blankets seemed cleaned

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Nothing! Everything was perfect
column9:
I loved everything about the hostel. 
The breakfast was simple but nice (toast with spreadables, milk, cereal, coffee and also a bit of fuit).
The staff in the hostel were sooo nice, especially Shafiqah, she helped me with the MRT and she recommended me places to go. 
The rooms are small but is not a big deal because you dont spend too much time in the room. The good thing about the beds is that you have your own plug, own light and curtain so you can have privacy.
The location was really good, like 8 min walking from the train station.
The bathroom was very clean, the clean it every day.
I would definitely stay again!!

column6: “The toilet attached to room was clean.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The breakfast area was so small and not comfortable. Don't provide family area or place for relaxing, only can sit on the bed.
column9: The toilet attached to room was clean. Value of money for room condition.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column9: This was a great hostel. You had your own bathroom between 8 in the room and if it was occupied there's was plenty more to use outside room. The breakfast was perfect to start you off for the day. Toast, cereal, tea/coffee and sliced oranges. The beds were comfy with a curtain for privacy. The hostel is very close to the mrt station too. Very good value!

column6: “The hostel is ideally situated if you want to be in the...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: A bit noisy at night. The corridors were full of sand.
column9:
The hostel is ideally situated if you want to be in the center of Little India. 
The beds are really private and the bathroom of the dorm is clean.

column6: “Young front office team and they are very polite  to the...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 5 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Common Bathroom commodes are hard to use.. they should give more  freedom space to use it..
column9: Young front office team and they are very polite  to the customers.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 6 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The room I got was very narrow/small, but I wouldn't consider this a negative because all the positives of this hostel outweigh the space restrictions. Their service is exemplary.
column9: I have stayed at multiple budget hostels in Singapore and by far this is the best budget hostel to stay.  Fortunately this hostel doesn't have a bedbug problem. It is best for solo/couple travel. The staffs are extremely helpful and humble.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 4 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column9:
Nice place to stay. Hostel is very close to Little India and Rocher MRT station. Welcoming staff, clean and comfy place, value for money, safety at main and room entrance. Would like to stay again if I visit Singapore again.
Thank you!!

column6: “Big value for money - nice location in Little India”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night']
column8: - The area for breakfast is very small so it can quickly be crowded
column9:
- Super friendly staff, I could leave my bag as I arrived a few hours before checkin time and the staff even offered to keep in a safe place my big camera bag so I didn't have to carry it all day
- Breakfast with some toasts, jam, butter, peanut butter, chocolate, cereals, coffee and tea. Basic but good. 
- Good location in Little India
- Comfortable bed with some privacy

column6: “Review from a Malaysian Muslim girl who travelled alone.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: I didnt like that I have to be very very very careful everytime handling my stuffs as Im afraid if it would disturb the other guests in the room. But since it is a hostel where we share room with few other guests, Im okay with that. Acceptable.
column9: I love the bed. Very comfortable that it wont let me get up easily. I slept like a log that night. I love that they provide breakfast in the morning (7.30am) so I wont be hungry on my way to the airport. I like the location, I can easily walk to few places, it is even a walking distance to the MRT Rochor and MRT Little India. It helps me save more money. I love how the receptions treat their guests. They were very polite and softspoken. I like the hotel 💙 Worth my money.

column6: “Very friendly staff thank you so much!”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column9: Very friendly staff thank you so much! They were available for any request and made the stay very nice. The location in little india is also very cool!

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 4 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Beds and curtains were making quirky noises sometimes.
column9:
Staff was really good and cooperative. In breakfast, they serve bread-butter, fruits, tea and coffee. They also provide travel assistance and tickets for various tourist attractions. Their rates are also less compare to original price. 
Nearest MRT station are Little India and Rocher (Downtown line)

column7: ['• Business trip', '• Group', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8: It's not convinience as I expect, less bathroom, room not cool enough but anyway when compare with money we spend may can not expect much.
column9: Location is good. Very easy to go around and not too quiet. You can find something to eat even night time.

column6: “Good place, good for your money, and friendly staff.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 4 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The bathroom was always wet. No matter the time of day the floor was puddled with water. Perhaps, maybe try and put a little ventilation system somewhere? Also, Although the beds were nice the room had very little space. It felt like I was sleeping in a storage closet.
column9: The staff, especially the female worker, were all friendly and helpful. If we needed directions on how to get somewhere or information about something the female worker, I can’t remember her name at the moment was extremely helpful.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Family Room of 4', '• Stayed 4 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Room was not cleaned daily 😔
column9: Cassandra was really helpful as it's our 1st family trip to overseas. She always gave us the creal directions with a smiley face when answering all our inquiries. Thank you Cassandra 🙋‍♀️

column6: “Breakfast and location was good. Other than that ,the stay wasn't pleasant.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The rooms were very congested. They asked for extra charge for even 1 hour early check-in. I was travelling with my mother and wanted atleast 1 Lower bed but they provided both upper beds which made our stay very uncomfortable and when we asked to change beds they asked for extra charge which was really bad.
column9: The breakfast provided was unlimited and awesome.It was the best part of the whole stay. Location is very good,5 mins walk from Little India mrt and 10 mins walk to Mustafa Centre.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Queen Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The place was nice overall, however in my opinion the lower part of the bunkbed is too cramped and small to manouver.
column9: The staff were great! Informative and friendly. Any issues regarding the room were attended immediately

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Queen Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Limited bathrooms for a hostel of around 30+ people. You really have to wake up early or wait for an hour just to use the toilet/ take a bath
column9: Beds are comfy and clean. The overall aesthetics of the place is wonderful too. Staff are very accommodating and will guide you through the check-in and check-out process.

column6: “The hostel was clean, staff was responsive to requests.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Breakfast was very basic. The female dorm room had very little room to walk or place large luggage. The top bunks are open on top, so when the lights turn on in the morning it will wake you up early.
column9: The hostel was clean, staff was responsive to requests. Beds had curtains, outlets and lights.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Queen Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8:
The place was booked up when we were there, and they didn't have enough bathrooms. There was only 1 bathroom in the dorm room for 14 people, and 1 additional bathroom in the walkway. With so many people using the limited bathrooms, you have to wait for your turn and it gets dirty pretty quickly.
The breakfast area is small with limited seating.
column9:
My husband and I chose the Queen bed in Mixed dorm. The mixed dorm room had 4 queen beds, and 6 single beds. The room was quite spacious, so it didn't feel cramped even with 16 people in it. Bed is clean and comfortable.
The staff there are great and helpful. Breakfast is simple (cereal, milk, toast, fruits). Location is pretty convenient with MRT stations about 10 mins walk away. It's about 5 mins walk away from Tekka Center, which is where you can eat lots of yummy and cheap local food. Definitely would recommend 7 Wonders!

column6: “Good airconditioner, clean bathroom and good assistance from...”
column7: ['• Business trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Uncomfortable for elderly people to climb up the bed,before allocating a bed, you should consider the age of the person and give the lower deck and upper for the young ones.
column9: Good airconditioner, clean bathroom and good assistance from the staff on locations where to go. Simple breakfast is fresh.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Can consider to make out a small area around the basin for us to put our little stuff ( toothpaste toothbrush face cleaner) when we need to brush our teeth clean our face in the morning
column9: It s a great location

column6: “The bed was super comfy with 4 pillows and a duvet for every...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Queen Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: There was just one bathroom in the room for 20 people and it was very small and a little bit dirty sometimes. The kitchen was too small for too many people.
column9: The bed was super comfy with 4 pillows and a duvet for every double bed. The people were very respectful in the room, it was not noisy at all. The staff was super friendly and let us to keep our bags all day after the check-out and even have a shower. They help you with everything.

column6: “Good budget option for travelling in Singapore overall”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night']
column8:
No remote control for air conditioning in the room, only staff have it. Someone in the room asked staff to set the temperature very low while others already caught cold, I wasn't able to sleep tight overnight and kept waking up due to freezing cold (staff wasn't around 11pm till 7am) and people snored loudly (which wasn't hostel's problem). 
The socket at my bedside had poor contact, wasn't able to use it to charge my phone, had to using the shared socket in the middle of the room to charge, didn't feel safe to leave it there overnight. The hostel is next to a street, so a bit noisy until 11pm. I was a bit worried about the beep from the door, but it's actually okay, I didn't find it really interrupting.
column9: Friendly and helpful staff, easy to check in and out. There's hot drinking water and a fridge in shared public area. In the bedroom there's a reading light and a socket at bedside, very convenient to use. The location of the hostel is close to Little India MRT station, with Tekka Centre nearly to buy fresh fruits and street food. It also has a shared bathroom outside of the room.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Few things as they dont have microwave, rooms are quite small if you are getting the Sahara category especially as they provide this room category to solo travellers or max 2 people.
column9: My stay was good here, it is value for money actually, Mainly Cassandra (Aka pikachu ) was very efficient towards her work, she will help you whatever if possible and she can do for there guest. Very happy with there services.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Queen Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
Small light kept on all night in rooms, if you're sensible to it might have to bring a mask or something
Shower might be cleaned a bit more often
Vey minimal breakfast made of toast, spreads and oranges but I guess okay for the price :)
column9:
Friendly staff
Very nice location right next to very cheap Indian food center and heart of little India, also close to metro station
Many bars and restaurants around
Comfy bed

column6: “Overall great experience, would definitely recommend to those on a backpackers budget.”
column7: ['• Business trip', '• Family with young children', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The breakfast area is a bit crowded. And please serve better coffee even if it’s just 3in1.
column9: Beds were very clean and comfortable. Cooling room throughout the day. Best part was the bathroom in the female dorm room. Close to mustafa centre and city square mall. Loved it!

column6: “Beware of the toilets, they are all not the same as picture”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 6 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Picture of the toilets are in two separate rooms. So if you get unlucky and don't get any of those rooms, you will get a far dirtier and smaller toilet.
column9: 2 of the staffs were very nice and the wifi was not bad.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The morning breakfast was a little squishy for space, but its complimentary so its worth it :)
column9: Staff were very helpful, with travelling, questions, recommendations, and even helped me to change my phone sim. Beds were super comfy, and the location is very close to two MRT stations which get you wherever you need.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
It would have been better if check in was before 3pm. We had been up since 4am to get a flight to Singapore and was clearly unwell and yet I was told I hate to wait until 3pm.
The dorm room was also for 14 people which is just a bit excessive really so we didn’t get a good night sleep because there is too much disturbance with this many people.
They have made the best of what there is of a common area but it is not a comfortable experience, only high chairs to perch on in a cramped area where people are coming in and out of all the time.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 4 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Not enough toilets/showers. 1 bathroom in each 12 bed dorm and only 4 more in the whole hostel.
column9: The staff were amazing. The rooms were big, didn’t feel like there was 12 people in there. Always clean. Breakfast was fresh. Really close walk to little India metro station to get anywhere in Singapore. Good air conditioning in the room. So cheap compared to the rest of Singapore. Would definitely stay again.

column6: “1. Bed is comfortable which is every bed provided with one...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Family Room of 8', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8:
1. The space quite small and cramp. So it is not really have enough space for those who bring luggage. Then, need to take turn to had breakfast since the pantry is not big. But it is ok since they also got few chairs at in front of room other than in the pantry.
2. It is quite far from Little India MRT Station for those who bring heavy backpack/luggage. But not more than 10 minutes walking distance from Little India MRT Station.
column9:
1. Bed is comfortable which is every bed provided with one socket and bed light.
2. I like it we had private bathroom since I've booked family room for 8 pax.
3. Even though the breakfast is simple (ie fruit, bread, cereal, coffee & tea) but the smell of toast bread was so tempted and delicious HAHAHA.
4. Room is clean. They provided towel for every bed and also got shower cream.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 6 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: Pantry was a bit cramped with people but the foods were very sufficient. Besides, there was no elevator so ask the staff to help you carry your heavy luggage just in case.
column9: Bathroom was spacious, there's laundry facilities for a fee, nice breakfast, friendly staffs and fast wifi connection.

column6: “Awesome location with great selection of choices for...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night']
column8: The rooms didn't have much floor space so if you have larger suitcases or backpacks they won't fit in the lockers under the bed and will take up quite a bit of space.
column9: Awesome location with great selection of choices for breakfast (cereals, various spreads for toast and fruit).

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Queen Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: One bathroom between 14 people and the door makes a loud beeping noise when your are inputting the code to enter. This really disrupted our sleep as people are in and out all night and into the early hours. Ok if you are a deep sleeper!
column9: Clean bathroom and dorm. Good branded cereal for breakfast.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Queen Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
We haven't slept two nights but because of people in the room... depend on the person...! 
Price are high but we are at Singapore! 😊
column9:
Good localization in little india. 
Staff was nice
Breakfast very good and illimited! 😊
Bed was clean! Good double bed!

column6: “The staff: Cassandra was the best and always helped with all...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• People with friends', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column9:
The staff: Cassandra was the best and always helped with all our needs:)
The location was great! We recommend the indian vegetarian restaurant across the street!

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights']
column8: It was not very clean... however I think it was not a hostel because they were cleaning several times a day. It was because of other guests in the dorm who were unfortunately very loud at night and quite dirty for my opinion.
column9: The location was really perfect. Also quite interesting and closed to one of the best food courts of the city. The personal was very friendly and helpful.

column6: “Staff were friendly and helpful, beds comfy and for hostel...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Queen Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 1 night', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: One shower in a dorm room of x5 bunk beds that's a lot of people for one shower.
column9: Staff were friendly and helpful, beds comfy and for hostel standards quite a lot of space. The breakfast included was great also (toast, cereal, coffee and fruit) clean modern hostel.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Family Room of 4', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
The room is a bit crowded. Its lucky for us to have a small physique so we didnt mind it so much.
I hope theres microwave at the kitchen so we can heat up some food.
column9: I like the pillow and the bed. Its very comfortable and fluffy. Feel did not want to get up in the morning. The breakfast is light and i like it.

column6: “breakfast, hairdryer, and iron provided from the hostel.”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• People with friends', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 4 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: small and tight place in the room
column9: breakfast, hairdryer, and iron provided from the hostel. the washing machine is also available but you must pay 4 dollars.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• People with friends', '• Family Room of 4', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8:
Toilet is small. 
Beddings not so clean.
column9: Good service of the staff esp. Cassandra and Murlis. Unli coffee and decent breakfast. Overall, this hostel deserves a thumbs up. Value for money.

column6: “I loved the bed setup - bed was very comfy and the linen was...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Solo traveller', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: My only criticism for this hostel would be that there was a very very slim corridor down the side of the beds. This sometimes meant that my bed curtain was moved as people went back and forth in the night. There wasn't a comfy social area to meet people.
column9: I loved the bed setup - bed was very comfy and the linen was super soft. Everything was very clean and could see people cleaning regularly. The staff were so so helpful, especially Cassandra who is an absolute gem, remembered me and was so helpful with advising me on how to get around. The location was excellent for good food, things to do and see, and for getting round - could not have been easier.

column6: “right by mrt downtown line which takes you to chinatown,...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Queen Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: the doors use a code system and automatically lock, whenever someone opens or locks the door it beeps very loudly so when you have people coming in and out if the dorm all night which can disturb your sleep and it’s really annoying.
column9: right by mrt downtown line which takes you to chinatown, gardens by the bay and the airport line. loads of cheapnokaces to eat close by in little india.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Couple', '• Queen Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 2 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The staff took it a bit serious with the climate. My girlfriend suffered a cold from this.
column9: For the price the place was in good shape. Check in and checkout were easy and the facilities had everything you need

column6: “The breakfast is quite nice and the choices of food are...”
column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8:
For some rooms, there might be a bed putting in the middle but without blocks.
It might put the tenant at risk.
column9:
The breakfast is quite nice and the choices of food are enough.
The staffs are nice.
The hotel is convenient and near two MRT station.

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Group', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 3 nights']
column8: I stayed in a upper bunk for a night and that bunk didnt have any boards or walls on one side. I talked to the reception but i couldnt change the bed as the hostel was fully booked that night. So it is rather unsafe to stay in that bed and it really depends on your luck. But fortunately Cassandra offered me a transfer to another safe bed when the hostel had available beds after the first night.
column9: Cassandra was very helpful

column7: ['• Leisure trip', '• Family with young children', '• Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room', '• Stayed 3 nights', '• Submitted via mobile']
column8: The aisle to the bed of the 6 people room is not spacious. The wifi in the room abit slow. But the wifi in the lobby was fast. The locker abit difficult to get locked.
column9: The service is very nice. Cassandra, one of the receptionist is very very very friendly. Give her bonus pls, hehe jk. The breakfast was worth the money. The hostel is very safe, because it has digital lock for main door and every rooms. The bed is verryyyyyy comfy and the room is clean. Overall its worth it and recommended.

column6: “It was okay, :) Value for Money for one or two nights stay.”

column9: Very new, modern, safe & clean hostel. Top location, next to MRT (Little India, Rochor, Jalan Besar). The bunks were very comfortable with comfy pillows, bed light, power plugs & curtains for privacy. The staff are very welcoming, professional and so helpful! They provide free maps & a lot of advice and information for sightseeing hotspots. Just ask them, they are glad to help you. We definitely can recommend a stay at this place!

column8: Confusing working hours - booking.com, their email assistant and the staff on the ground didn't seem to agree on what was the final time for checkin (turned out to be 11pm, they said it might change when they have more staff). The upside was that I did manage to find a member of their staff, who checked me in at 12am and was very nice and helpful. There was a big group at some point and bath/toilets were hard to get to.
